instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.R7005: What is R7005? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP3V3_S4: What is PP3V3_S4? The "PP3V3_S4" power rail in a MacBook is used to supply 3.3 volts to certain components when the system is in the S4 power state, also known as "suspend to disk" or "hibernate." This rail is active when the MacBook is not fully off but not in an awake state, allowing for faster startup times compared to a full boot sequence. The S4 power state means Suspend to Disk: This is a low-power state where the system context is saved to disk, allowing the system to be powered down almost entirely. Upon waking, the system can restore its state from the disk, effectively resuming where it left off..

threads.title: [SOLVED]820 2936 - Green light  not turning ON! PPBUS - 13.2V
threads.message:
Hey,

no liquid damage this board, but already touched the components in other storage..

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 13.2V
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.4v

<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>= 3.3v

Pin 17/18 <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>: 3.1 Ohms

Pin 27/28 <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>: 21.5 Ohms

<RESISTOR>R7005</RESISTOR>:20.1 Ohms

Any suggestion -?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820 2936 - Green light  not turning ON! PPBUS - 13.2V
threads.message: Does it charge the battery??? Orange light when battery connected?? try SMC bypass, does ti power on?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820 2936 - Green light  not turning ON! PPBUS - 13.2V
threads.message: 13.2V is not good. You sure about that? Should not be higher than 12.6V. But it should power on regardless, the usual <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>? PPVRTC? Inspect for pre-fucked damage.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820 2936 - Green light  not turning ON! PPBUS - 13.2V
threads.message: no orange light. PPVRTC = 3.3V, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> = 3.3V ..the beginning i change <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and the machine start with battery but after that don't start anymore.. SMC bypass?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820 2936 - Green light  not turning ON! PPBUS - 13.2V
threads.message:
Make sure <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> is good then, if you truely have 13.2V <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> probably something is not alright in that area. Check it

Voltage of <SIGNAL>PM_SLEEP_S4_L</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820 2936 - Green light  not turning ON! PPBUS - 13.2V
threads.message: i have 3.3v too!! WTF , i have all voltages to start but don't start... any more idea?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820 2936 - Green light  not turning ON! PPBUS - 13.2V
[SOLVED]820 2936 - Green light  not turning ON! PPBUS - 13.2V
threads.message:
it was <SIGNAL>PM_SLEEP_S4_L</SIGNAL>.. But now, i change <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> for one i know is good and 

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = unstable 1V - 3V,

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.5v

i checked 2 times if the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> is well soldering!

threads.title: [SOLVED]820 2936 - Green light  not turning ON! PPBUS - 13.2V
threads.message: I have no idea what you are doing. Why change <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> if PPBUS was present. I cannot help you sorry.

threads.title: [SOLVED]820 2936 - Green light  not turning ON! PPBUS - 13.2V
threads.message: I can explain.. I was not sure that the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> chip was good. I paid 15 euros for 2 <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> to make sure that what I was getting this good. I just had the bad luck not to soldering well.. I have now soldered the component well and now I can see <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.3V .. now i know the problem is the SMC!

threads.title: [SOLVED]820 2936 - Green light  not turning ON! PPBUS - 13.2V
threads.message:
Are you sure the issue is the SMC? Because you're getting a green light so the SMC is atleast doing something.

You can't really properly conclude if the SMC is working based on the <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage since your measurements haven't been the most accurate so far. Making it unsure if we're just looking at a lower PPBUS voltage or a inaccurate reading. (Are your batteries in your multimeter in need of a replacement?)
You can try to reflow it I guess, though.

What are the voltages of: <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> now?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820 2936 - Green light  not turning ON! PPBUS - 13.2V
threads.message: All voltages are present. thank for your reply

threads.title: [SOLVED]820 2936 - Green light  not turning ON! PPBUS - 13.2V
threads.message: So <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S4</SIGNAL> is present, is it the right voltage? How about S0 power lines, how are they doing?

threads.title: [SOLVED]820 2936 - Green light  not turning ON! PPBUS - 13.2V
threads.message: SMC replaced and i have a solid ppbus 12.53V .. And All work fine. can close the post! Thank you all
